channel.title: Cryptum - A New Legacy Has Arrived!
channel.description:
[CENTER][IMG]http://i.imgur.com/nwP6843.png[/img][/CENTER]
[B]NOTICE: Now that I have a development team, this server will be based on player vs. player until enough content is added for a stable economy. Expect a beta release as soon as server clipping is finished![/B]
[B]What is Cryptum?[/B]
[I]Cryptum is a RuneScape private server based off the 600+ protocol. Our goal is to achieve a fully functional server with plenty of interactions and miscellaneous things for players to do. One thing that most servers lack is social interactions. With out a good player base, a server is nothing and is most likely dull and boring. We don't want that to happen. We want you to enjoy your time on the game and just flat out have fun with your friends! But you can only do that when you enjoy yourself in the game too. We think that a server with the home location at Edgeville and basic shops and junk is ridiculous. We want to spice things up a bit. How will be do this? By adding events, quests and a butt load of content of course! This project is going to take a while, but we hope that we can achieve this with the little spare time that we have. Anyways, enough of all this blabbering and let's get to the content.[/I]
[b]Latest plan:[/b]
[i]I want the game to have some sort of story, to make it interesting ya' know? After the Isles of Gielinor, I really thought these concepts were cool. I'm thinking possibly, you start out in the Lumbridge cellar. You have no idea who you are or why you are here. Your whole story is based off you trying to find out who you are by doing quests and missions for clues. (quickly typed-up plot.)[/i]
This server is based off the custom framework called Niobe and was created by Relex Lawl.
[B]Core Information:[/B]
[ul][li]Netty networking - single and multi-core updating[/li] [li]Action system - following, clicking entities, and movement (etc.)[/li] [li]Item Containers - Banking, Duel Arena, Party Room, New Shop Interfaces (etc.)[/li] [li]Game Character based combat[/li] [li]Entity definitions - game objects, items, and NPC's[/li] [li]Weapon system - special attacks and setups[/li] [li]Tasks - restoring run energy, restoring skill levels (etc.)[/li] [li]Clan chat - full dropshare and lootshare including message colors, ranks, settings, and saving.[/li] [li]Fully complete combat system - perfect formulas and items (etc.)[/li] [li]Amazing dialogue system - all dialogues, structures, and items[/li] [li]Abstract skilling system - for fast, complete, and easy skill additions[/li] [li]Transporting - necklaces, tablets, teleports (etc.)[/li][/ul]
[b]Mini-games:[/b]
[i]Barrows:[/i]
[ul][li]Prayer draining upon being in a crypt along with barrows head on the player's screen[/li] [li]Random brother being at the crypt in the middle; can spawn upon using doors[/li] [li]Rocks falling every X amount of ticks after opening barrows chest[/li] [li]Mini-map blacking out upon being in a crypt[/li][/ul]
[i]Fight Caves:[/i]
[ul][li]All 63 waves are fight-able[/li] [li]Waves are saved and players can log out and back in to their current wave[/li] [li]Upon death, players can either not receive any tokkul (if they do not pass wave 1), receive some tokkul for effort (depends on waves) or receive X amount of tokkul and fire cape (upon killing Jad)[/li] [li]Cannot bring familiars in here[/li][/ul]
[i]Duel Arena:[/i]
[ul][li]All rules work (except fun weapons) and certain equipment slots cannot be used, no drinks, no food (etc.)[/li] [li]Staking with no duplications[/li] [li]Forfeit with OptionDialogue[/li][/ul]
[i]Warriors Guild:[/i]
[ul][li]Animating armour sets (bronze, iron, steel, adamant and rune)[/li] [li]Cyclops drop defenders depending on which defender you have[/li] [li]All of the dialogues[/li] [li]Upon killing a cyclops, you may also get a chance of spawning in a Cyclossus, which have a high chance of dropping dragon defenders and cyclops helmets[/li][/ul]
[i]Clan Wars:[/i]
[ul][li]Currently the dangerous and safe portals only[/li][/ul]
[i]God Wars Dungeon:[/i]
[ul][li]Every door or passage to get to the respective God Wars boss works[/li] [li]NPC's of different gods are aggressive on each other.[/li] [li]NPC's of a god will attack a player unless they're wearing an item of the respective god[/li] [li]All of the bosses have their special abilities.[/li] [li]Kill count in the top right corner[/li][/ul]
[i]Soul Wars:[/i]
[ul][li]Experience shop interface working (need to do the others)[/li] [li]Correct waiting room and in-game interfaces[/li] [li]Balance portal will bring you to the team with least amount of players[/li] [li]Bone burying in a graveyard your team controls can raise your avatar's slayer requirement and also can increase your constitution by a bit[/li] [li]Activity bar working, will kick you out after X amount of warnings[/li] [li]Cannot enter a game which has 6 minutes or less of minutes remaining[/li] [li]Every X amount of time the controlled areas are updated (west and east graveyards and soul obelisk - team with most amount of players in said area "controls" it)[/li] [li]Set to be a ghost upon death and cannot re-enter the battlefield until back to normal[/li] [li]Using soul fragments on soul obelisk lower the opposing team's avatar's slayer requirement[/li] [li]Jellies and pyre fiends spawning and dropping soul fragments; players will drop their fragments upon death and will be seen by everyone[/li] [li]1 point upon losing, 2 points upon draw and 3 points upon winning; winning is based on who has less avatar deaths[/li][/ul]
[i]Pest Control:[/i]
[ul][li]Easy, Medium and Hard boat with the correct interface[/li] [li]Can have multiple games for each boat (3-25 players per game)[/li] [li]Pests spawned on portals who's shields are down (think it's like this on rs)[/li] [li]Defilers, spinners, and shifters attack void knight[/li][/ul]
[b]Completed Skills:[/b]
[ul][li]Cooking[/li] [li]Fishing[/li] [li]Mining[/li] [li]Prayer[/li] [li]Woodcutting[/li] [li]Summoning (base)[/li][/ul]
[b]Media and Extras:[/b] (Image credits to Relex and Eliminate)
[IMG]http://imageshack.us/a/img821/4830/tah3.png[/img] [IMG]http://imageshack.us/a/img534/8981/l41e.png[/img] [IMG]http://imageshack.us/a/img6/5910/46js.png[/img] [IMG]http://imageshack.us/a/img802/9484/pzco.png[/img] [IMG]http://imageshack.us/a/img209/1278/3oek.png[/img] [IMG]http://imageshack.us/a/img208/510/gbg1.png[/img] item.title: Cryptum - A New Legacy Has Arrived!
item.dc:creator: @Anval Anval
item.description:
@Anval wrote:

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:16, topic:535346”]is this a real 600?

regardless, looks interesting, good luck my dude :)[/quote]

No, it’s not a real 600+. It’s a 317 loading 600+ data, but the reason I’m doing this is because it’s another excuse to use the Keldagrim client.

EDIT: I take nearly to none of the credit in this thread so far. It’s mainly Relex’s work.

Read full topic

item.title: Cryptum - A New Legacy Has Arrived!
item.dc:creator: @Bl3nd Bl3nd
item.description:
@Bl3nd wrote:

[quote=“Anval, post:12, topic:535346”]I didn’t expect anyone to bump this while I was editing the thread. O.O. Well, the main reason was because I didn’t have enough time to actually write everything I was expecting in my plan, because this is basically what it would have turned into eventually. But thanks! Expect some updates on this though, because I don’t have much homework through November and December, including extra time for the Thanksgiving and Christmas breaks!

EDIT: Who knows, I may keep Blue Moon planned for sometime in the future.[/quote]

I myself, is developing the Aero source. But there needs to be so many packets to be added

Dang, nice pictures. Liking the updates so far

Read full topic

@Anval wrote:

I didn’t expect anyone to bump this while I was editing the thread. O.O. Well, the main reason was because I didn’t have enough time to actually write everything I was expecting in my plan, because this is basically what it would have turned into eventually. But thanks! Expect some updates on this though, because I don’t have much homework through November and December, including extra time for the Thanksgiving and Christmas breaks!

EDIT: Who knows, I may keep Blue Moon planned for sometime in the future.

item.title: Cryptum - A New Legacy Has Arrived!
item.dc:creator: @Anval Anval
item.description:
@Anval wrote:

[CENTER][/CENTER]

[B]NOTICE: Now that I have a development team, this server will be based on player vs. player until enough content is added for a stable economy. Expect a beta release as soon as server clipping is finished![/B]

[B]What is Cryptum?[/B]

[I]Cryptum is a RuneScape private server based off the 600+ protocol. Our goal is to achieve a fully functional server with plenty of interactions and miscellaneous things for players to do. One thing that most servers lack is social interactions. With out a good player base, a server is nothing and is most likely dull and boring. We don’t want that to happen. We want you to enjoy your time on the game and just flat out have fun with your friends! But you can only do that when you enjoy yourself in the game too. We think that a server with the home location at Edgeville and basic shops and junk is ridiculous. We want to spice things up a bit. How will be do this? By adding events, quests and a butt load of content of course! This project is going to take a while, but we hope that we can achieve this with the little spare time that we have. Anyways, enough of all this blabbering and let’s get to the content.[/I]

Latest plan:

I want the game to have some sort of story, to make it interesting ya’ know? After the Isles of Gielinor, I really thought these concepts were cool. I’m thinking possibly, you start out in the Lumbridge cellar. You have no idea who you are or why you are here. Your whole story is based off you trying to find out who you are by doing quests and missions for clues. (quickly typed-up plot.)

This server is based off the custom framework called Niobe and was created by Relex Lawl.

[B]Core Information:[/B]

[ul][li]Netty networking - single and multi-core updating[/li]
[li]Action system - following, clicking entities, and movement (etc.)[/li]
[li]Item Containers - Banking, Duel Arena, Party Room, New Shop Interfaces (etc.)[/li]
[li]Game Character based combat[/li]
[li]Entity definitions - game objects, items, and NPC’s[/li]
[li]Weapon system - special attacks and setups[/li]
[li]Tasks - restoring run energy, restoring skill levels (etc.)[/li]
[li]Clan chat - full dropshare and lootshare including message colors, ranks, settings, and saving.[/li]
[li]Fully complete combat system - perfect formulas and items (etc.)[/li]
[li]Amazing dialogue system - all dialogues, structures, and items[/li]
[li]Abstract skilling system - for fast, complete, and easy skill additions[/li]
[li]Transporting - necklaces, tablets, teleports (etc.)[/li][/ul]

Mini-games:

Barrows:

[ul][li]Prayer draining upon being in a crypt along with barrows head on the player’s screen[/li]
[li]Random brother being at the crypt in the middle; can spawn upon using doors[/li]
[li]Rocks falling every X amount of ticks after opening barrows chest[/li]
[li]Mini-map blacking out upon being in a crypt[/li][/ul]

Fight Caves:

[ul][li]All 63 waves are fight-able[/li]
[li]Waves are saved and players can log out and back in to their current wave[/li]
[li]Upon death, players can either not receive any tokkul (if they do not pass wave 1), receive some tokkul for effort (depends on waves) or receive X amount of tokkul and fire cape (upon killing Jad)[/li]
[li]Cannot bring familiars in here[/li][/ul]

Duel Arena:

[ul][li]All rules work (except fun weapons) and certain equipment slots cannot be used, no drinks, no food (etc.)[/li]
[li]Staking with no duplications[/li]
[li]Forfeit with OptionDialogue[/li][/ul]

Warriors Guild:

[ul][li]Animating armour sets (bronze, iron, steel, adamant and rune)[/li]
[li]Cyclops drop defenders depending on which defender you have[/li]
[li]All of the dialogues[/li]
[li]Upon killing a cyclops, you may also get a chance of spawning in a Cyclossus, which have a high chance of dropping dragon defenders and cyclops helmets[/li][/ul]

Clan Wars:

[ul][li]Currently the dangerous and safe portals only[/li][/ul]

God Wars Dungeon:

[ul][li]Every door or passage to get to the respective God Wars boss works[/li]
[li]NPC’s of different gods are aggressive on each other.[/li]
[li]NPC’s of a god will attack a player unless they’re wearing an item of the respective god[/li]
[li]All of the bosses have their special abilities.[/li]
[li]Kill count in the top right corner[/li][/ul]

Soul Wars:

[ul][li]Experience shop interface working (need to do the others)[/li]
[li]Correct waiting room and in-game interfaces[/li]
[li]Balance portal will bring you to the team with least amount of players[/li]
[li]Bone burying in a graveyard your team controls can raise your avatar’s slayer requirement and also can increase your constitution by a bit[/li]
[li]Activity bar working, will kick you out after X amount of warnings[/li]
[li]Cannot enter a game which has 6 minutes or less of minutes remaining[/li]
[li]Every X amount of time the controlled areas are updated (west and east graveyards and soul obelisk - team with most amount of players in said area “controls” it)[/li]
[li]Set to be a ghost upon death and cannot re-enter the battlefield until back to normal[/li]
[li]Using soul fragments on soul obelisk lower the opposing team’s avatar’s slayer requirement[/li]
[li]Jellies and pyre fiends spawning and dropping soul fragments; players will drop their fragments upon death and will be seen by everyone[/li]
[li]1 point upon losing, 2 points upon draw and 3 points upon winning; winning is based on who has less avatar deaths[/li][/ul]

Pest Control:

[ul][li]Easy, Medium and Hard boat with the correct interface[/li]
[li]Can have multiple games for each boat (3-25 players per game)[/li]
[li]Pests spawned on portals who’s shields are down (think it’s like this on rs)[/li]
[li]Defilers, spinners, and shifters attack void knight[/li][/ul]

Completed Skills:

[ul][li]Cooking[/li]
[li]Fishing[/li]
[li]Mining[/li]
[li]Prayer[/li]
[li]Woodcutting[/li]
[li]Summoning (base)[/li][/ul]

Media and Extras: (Image credits to Relex and Eliminate)









































































[right]Credits:
Relex Lawl
(Anybody else that contributed)[/right]

Read full topic
item.source: Cryptum - A New Legacy Has Arrived!
